column2: Malign spirits dog the foes’ every step, tripping them at important moments, poking their eyes when they need to see, and forcing them to bark obscenities when they try to give orders.
The Hag speaks with the pitiless chill of the Ancient Widow, demanding her enemies to suffer her wrath.
With a single breath, the caster blows a freezing gale at anyone in front of him within 48 yards.
The Hag summons a myriad of friendly spirits to invigorate her allies.
The Hag’s eyes turn blue as she enters a trance and commune with the spirits, foretelling those close to her about the ensuing enemy encounter.
The caster channels Ice Magic upwards, forming large chunks of ice that fall to the ground with horrifying speed.
A swirling flurry of snow and ice rises from the land, freezing and blinding all in its path.
Sharp icicles spring from the mage's hand in the direction of the target, causing multiple wounds as they pierce and impale their targets.
This curse attracts diseased spirits that sicken those too weak to resist them; they soar in a great swarm around the caster's foes, infusing them with all manner of malign illnesses.
The Hag mutters some ancient words and suddenly a spiritual shield materialises and protects the friendly regiments from damage.
Channels mighty flows of magic into a howling gale of cold. Anyone between the caster and his target is slashed by wind-whipped ice shards.

A furious blizzard stirs up around the enemy target, stopping them in their tracks. The troops are temporarily immobilized by the strong winds and biting cold, rendering them unable to move and causing severe damage.
The bond of the Hag Witch with the spirit world is so powerful, that nightmarish visions hinder all enemy movements every time she casts a spell.
When the Ice Witch casts a spell, the forces of winter come to her aid, crippling the enemy's resistance.
Ursun, also known as the Great Bear, or Father Bear is the God of Bears and Strength and the patron god of Kislev.
A symbol of Ursun's glory, this powerful beast is always faithful to the Red Tzar.
Although a rare sight, a few powerful Priest of Ursun are seen riding wild bears.
A barded warhorse shows the true wealth of the Kislevite Lord.
A barded warhorse shows the true wealth of the Kislevite Lord.
The Lords of Kislev always ride the best and most hardy horses to battle.
The Lords of Kislev always ride the best and most hardy horses to battle.
The Lords of Kislev always ride the best and most hardy horses to battle.
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
The ice pegasi are rare creatures known to live in the cold, distant lands of Kislev. Legends say that only Ice Witches can tame them.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
